definition: to set out (on a campaign)/to stand for election/to throw one's cap in the ring

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away

sentences.english: Parliamentary debate would supposedly give the game away.
sentences.chinese: 议会辩论可能会露出马脚。

sentences.english: Oh, you've finally got on the track, Mr.
sentences.chinese: 哈哈，你终于露出马脚了，欧先生。

sentences.english: This time the fifth brother took the fourth brother's place.
sentences.chinese: 这回，由老五取代老四出马了。

sentences.english: Now it appears that parents, at least are taking matters into their own hands.
sentences.chinese: 不过现在看来，至少父母们已经开始亲自出马了。

sentences.english: Fine clothes may disguise, but silly words will disclose a fool.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的外衣可以包装傻瓜，但蠢话总会露出马脚。

sentences.english: Now the chief decided to go himself.
sentences.chinese: 这一次首领决定亲自出马。

sentences.english: Even without a teacher, the village people would ask him to run for paper-cut wedding.
sentences.chinese: 无师自通之后，村里人办喜事都会请他出马剪纸。

sentences.english: He meets a 20-year-old and is immediately smitten.
sentences.chinese: 他一遇到这个20岁的女孩，就会立刻出马。

sentences.english: Han Xuan, sitting on the wall, sent Huang Zhong out.
sentences.chinese: 韩玄坐在城上，教黄忠出马。

sentences.english: If you are traveling alone, try to hide that fact.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是单独出行，可千万别露出马脚。

sentences.english: Perfectly passable inexpensive pieces are given away time and again by their crappy buttons.
sentences.chinese: 廉价的还可以让衣服屡次被它们糟糕的扣子露出马脚。

sentences.english: But at these prices, it is difficult to avoid a paper trail.
sentences.chinese: 但是，以这样的价钱，很难不在个人账面上露出马脚。

definition: to be fair/to be impartial/to settle (a matter etc)
to appear personally/to step in/to step forth/to show up
to persuade
to possess great magical power/to possess remarkable abilities
in my opinion
to give a nod of approval
to intercede/to plead for sb else
to bring up the rear/to provide support/to hold the lines
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
to leave the mountain (of a hermit)/to come out of obscurity to a government job/to take a leading position
to make a decision/to make up one's mind
to clear up the mess/to pick up the pieces
don't use a sledgehammer on a nut/aquila non capit muscam
pinyin: sha1 ji1 yan1 yong4 niu2 dao1

definition: see 作主[zuo4 zhu3]
to ask for instructions
stretch a hand and grab it (idiom); very easy
